info.title: Rajawalinet H2H Documentation
info.description:
This Documentation API is aimed at clients who will collaborate with Rajawali Telecommunication Cellular # Response Code Dictionary #
Response CodeResponse Message
000000Success
500002Mitra Business not active
500101Mitra not Found
500102Product Code not Available
500103Command for Product not found
500104Balance not Enough
500105Transaction on Limit
500106Transaction Not Found
500107Reference ID Required
500108Price Amount and Total Fee Amount required
500109Reference ID Not Valid
501903Failed to payment - Payment Process has been done
501005Amount different from inquiry
501004Payment need Inquiry
600201Payment Code not found
600202Mitra not Found
600204Payment not found
600205Payment not active
600206Payment ID Required
600207Transaction ID Required
600212Payment Adapter Under Maintenance
999999Internal Server Error
# Authentication # From (RTS/ES) will provide an ***API KEY*** as a marker that partners have been allowed to access H2H. ## Obtain Access Token ## To get the Access Token, you can use the following API specifications:
URI /api/auth/login
Method POST
Request Body { "api_key":"{API KEY}" }
Example Response Body { "access_token": "jwt_access_token", "refresh_token": "jwt_refresh_token", "token_type": "Bearer ", "expired_in": 3600000, "signature_key": "signature_key" }
## Signature ## After getting the Login Process, partners will get a ***Signature Key*** from the response given. The Signature Key is used as a Key in the creation of a Hash Signature which is included in the Request Process Header. To get the ***signature*** Hash method used is ***HMAC-SHA256***:
Date In Format: yyyy-MM-dd(ex: 2021-08-20)
Example JSON {“json_key”:”data a”}
Data Signature Date + # + Request Body (in JSON (remove whitespace))

Example:

2021-08-21#{“json_key”:”dataa”}
Signature Method: HMAC-SHA256(var data, var key)

Using Method:
HMAC-SHA256(Data Signature, Signature Key)
Example Signature example json: {"module_type":"PAYMENT","data":{"payment_id":"va-cimb","payment_command":"get-status","transaction_id":"0PERTAMINA0000VACIMB1635769235270049"}}
example key: VqjVZfnYGSZJHXrLZbSJGPerz
example text to signature: 2021-11-10#{"module_type":"PAYMENT","data":{"payment_id":"va-cimb","payment_command":"get-status","transaction_id":"0PERTAMINA0000VACIMB1635769235270049"}}
result: ae0ff835ce725c1a80a4538cd4129813db280507ce181259098fee7df9b11d08
result of signature can you check on: https://www.devglan.com/online-tools/hmac-sha256-online and you can test minify on: https://codebeautify.org/remove-whitespace

post.description: Callback process when your transaction response status is "ON_PROCESS"
Body JSON same with response on return when transaction process

tags.name: Payment Module
tags.description:
## Parameter ##
ParameterDescription
payment_idPayment ID for transaction type
payment_commandCommand for process
product(Optional) product name
reference_numberReference number from partner
amountAmount transaction
callback_url(Optional)Callback URL for callback process
parameterParameter for transaction request

tags.name: PPOB Module
tags.description:
### Status

On PPOB module has 3 status

*   SUCCESS - Status for transaction is success from Biller
*   PENDING - Status for transaction is in process on Biller
*   FAILED - Status for transaction is failed on Biller
    

for clients can find out the latest status when Status in PENDING state,  
client can implement:

1.  Callback Mechanism
2.  Get Status Transaction
    

for callback, our system has 2 callback type:

1.  Transaction Callback: callback for information to client ,final result from transaction for transaction status is "ON PROCESS".
2.  Get List Product Trigger: callback for trigger to inform client, when there is price changes, and after client get this callback, client can get endpoint "Get Product List" for get new price list.
    

Callback URI:

| **Type** | **URI** | **Method** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Transaction Callback | /transaction | POST |
| Get List Product Trigger | /product-list | POST |

after client implement those specification, please inform your base url to RTS

how it's work?

example:

your base url: yourdomain.com/api/biller/callback

so. when if the conditions are met, we will inform you on your endpoint:

Transaction Callback: yourdomain.com/api/biller/callback/transaction

Transaction Callback: yourdomain.com/api/biller/callback/product-list

for **Transaction Callback** specs can follow "**Callback Specification**"
